intro: Crossopetalum rhacoma, commonly known as the mountain hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its showy, pentagonal flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant typically grows in forested areas and has heart-shaped leaves with a smooth texture. It produces capsule fruits that contain numerous small, hairy seeds.
